intro: Lobelia hainanensis, commonly known as Hainan lobelia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Hainan in China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
